item.title: Epic's Plan To Get Fortnite Back On iOS Has Hit A Snag In The UK
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After successfully getting Fortnite reinstated on iOS through the App Store in the US and the Epic Games Store in the European Union, Epic Games' plans to follow either of these paths in the UK has hit a regulatory dead end.

Epic has posted a blog update expressing disappointment with the CMA, the competition regulator for the UK, after its roadmap included no plan to open the mobile landscape for alternative app stores like the Epic Game Store. "Four years after concluding that the App Store and Google Play Store are parallel monopolies the CMA has done nothing to allow competing stores," Epic says.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Fortnite x Sabrina Carpenter - Wish You Were Here Reveal Trailer

According to Epic, the CMA has "deprioritized store competition entirely, to be considered sometime in 2026." It references the EU's Digital Markets Act as a benchmark for allowing alternative app stores on mobile devices, citing a number of alternative stores that have sprung up in Europe including AltStore, Aptoide, and its own Epic Games Store.

"The CMA also made a vague announcement about allowing developers to steer customers to payment service outside of apps, without referencing the kinds of restrictions, obstructions and junk fees that Apple introduced in Europe to make a mockery of the Digital Markets Act," Epic's statement continues. "Unless Apple and Google are completely blocked from imposing fees and discriminating against apps using out-of-app payment, we can expect years of malicious compliance ahead."

Epic again references one of its previous legal battles here, saying that the recent US court order against Apple has set the standard by outlawing all fees and obstructions on apps that choose to direct customers to external payment services.

"Today's bleak news from the United Kingdom contrasts to the stronger pro-competition actions of other regions," Epic concludes, though the company will no doubt continue to put pressure on the CMA to introduce stronger antitrust laws targeting Apple and Google. Outside of its victories in Europe and the US, Epic says that the Epic Games Store will also be launched in Brazil and Japan later this year.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: ModRetro's N64 Tribute Console Has A Price, Launches Later This Year
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Retro gaming fans might have to make a difficult choice soon, as ModRetro has revealed that its modern-day tribute to the Nintendo 64 console will cost $200. First teased last year, this could make it a viable alternative to the Analogue 3D, which costs $250.

ModRetro's newest product is M64. The best and most authentic way to play your favorite N64 games, bar none. Prepare your wallet and brace your mind.

Launches at the same price as the original Nintendo 64. Inflation isn't nostalgic. pic.twitter.com/LYDyiBBx2O

â€” Palmer Luckey (@PalmerLuckey) July 24, 2025

Like the Analogue 3D, the M64 is also an FPGA console that aims to replicate the experience of using an N64 at a hardware level. This is the same direction that ModRetro took for the ModRetro Chromatic, a well-designed Game Boy successor that combines several modern conveniences with an authentic handheld gaming experience that can easily run all of your original Game Boy cartridges. The handheld also feels great to use, thanks to all of the premium materials incorporated into its design.

Beyond that, ModRetro hasn't revealed any other details regarding the M64. The teaser trailer posted by company founder Palmer Luckey does have a very blurry tease of the device--and a "do not open until Christmas" message--and it looks like it'll sport a grey color scheme. The video also suggests that you'll be able to use your original N64 cartridges, and it'll be interesting to see if it has any of the other modern features built into the Chromatic, like native video streaming and multiplayer support.

FPGA consoles like this are generally seen as the best option for enthusiasts, due to them being able to play these games in HD via HDMI on a modern television. The Analogue 3D can do this in 4K, and it offers a variety of filters to make the experience look like you're playing on a CRT TV, so it'll be interesting to see if the M64 can offer a similar experience.

If you're a bigger fan of Nintendo's handheld gaming age, you can order the ModRetro Chromatic right now, as new stock has arrived and it's also available in several new colors.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Wuchang: Fallen Feathers - Guides Hub
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The titular character in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers is a pirate warrior who's lost her memory. Worse, she's suffering from a curse known as the Feathering, a disease that eventually turns people into monsters. Now, it's up to you to break this cycle as you explore Sichuan Province in a dark fantasy adventure set during the collapse of the Ming Dynasty. Our Wuchang: Fallen Feathers guides hub has all the tips you need for the journey ahead.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • Wuchang: Fallen Feathers - Guides hub
    • Starter guides and how tos
    • Weapon and gear guides
    • Exploration and rewards guides

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers - Guides hub

Starter guides and how tos

Campaign length: How long does it take to beat the game - Find out how many hours you need to spend if you wish to see the conclusion of the campaign.

How to summon companions - One particular item lets you summon companions to aid you in battle, though some require you to finish a few tasks first.

How to cure Frostbite - This debilitating debuff severely impacts your stamina and, thus, your mobility and avoidance, too.

How to cure Despair - This malady is quite insidious. If you're not careful, it can instantly cause your character to perish.

How to cure Madness - This Wuchang: Fallen Feathers guide discusses everything you need to know about the Madness mechanic, which is akin to a high-risk, high-reward system.

Weapon and gear guides

How to upgrade weapons - Use materials known as Red Feathers to boost weapon mastery.

How to unlock temper acupoints - Bone Needles and Stone Needles grant bonus effects for your armaments.

All armors and costumes - This Wuchang: Fallen Feathers guide is more like a showcase on what each armor set looks like.

Exploration and rewards guides

Manna Vase upgrades - Find Forgotten Remembrances and Lost Remains to improve the potency of your health flask.

Wu Gang items and rewards - If you find certain valuables, you can hand them over to this NPC to unlock additional wares. Many of these rewards are very unique as well.

Panda Bamboo Shoots - Look for scurrying critters and bring these resources to a Giant Panda NPC.

Points-of-interest: Faces of the Past - These landmarks have a strange glow. Picking the right emote nets you some nifty rewards, too.

We'll continue to add more articles to our Wuchang: Fallen Feathers guides hub. Stay the course as you face more challenges throughout the campaign.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/wuchang-fallen-feathers-guides-hub/1100-6533360/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
